fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36296].
  {panel}

Hey,

I think it would be a really helpful improvement to save somehow the user's form (like the create issue form for eg.) and restore it back if some error occurs. Like for example:
I am on the wifi network 1 and complete a form with multiple fields and settings and then go to another place with my laptop and the laptop connects to another wifi network (I don't always get notified about that) through which the confluence/jira is not available and if I press submit/create/update I am getting an error and the data is gone.. that is terribly bad because I spent about 1h on writing that form and it would be a bit strange to do that in another text editor and paste it in attlassian just to overcome this :( also the bad thing is that the form might have other types of fileds than the texts ones..

Do you think there is a chance for me to have this?

Thank you very much!
fields.summary: Restore form data if an error happens

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36292].
  {panel}

It's currently really hard for a plugin developer to migrate attachments that had their IDs remapped due to the attachment to CEO work. We should add a method in a manager that lets you get the old and new attachment IDs so that the plugin devs can write their own upgrade tasks.

Calling the method will be done via a new method in the [compat lib|https://bitbucket.org/slancashire/confluence-attachment-to-ceo-compat/commits/56472132fc3f8e609022c83f7eccca475dcd90d9] that uses reflection to see if the method on the manager exists, or returns an empty result if it does not (nothing to migrate)

Unfortunately our plugin upgrade task infrastructure is not suitable for such an upgrade task - because if they want their plugin to be compatible with both pre 5.7 and 5.7+, and the upgrade task determines it has no work to do pre 5.7, it will never run again.

We could add something to the compatibility library that when registered as a component runs each time the plugin starts and the user implements an abstract method that does their migration and maybe another that provides a unique string that identifies their plugin. We then write some code to store the fact that the migration has been run.
fields.summary: Provide an easy way for plugin devs to migrate attachment IDs
HTML tags appear in excerpts using the page tree macro
Add Scroll Office plugin to the list of Atlassian Cloud Add ons
Source Code for Confluence-Basic-Macros
Show space name when linking to pages
When using the "Open Macro Browser" dropdown menu, the macro list isn't updated to match the filter.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36285].
  {panel}

Hey,

First of all - thank you for allowing users to open tickets in JIRA. This is awesome.

Secondly - I would like to suggest an auto-anchoring mechanism like google does. Usually, when anchoring, it's a sub-header within a specific document. We create those anchors in confluence to reference a sub-feature or a minor issue which can serve many people in the documentation.

I believe it would save a lot of time if you by default anchor any sub-header (all "h" hierarchy, 1 to inifinity).

Thanks!
fields.summary: Anchor all headers & sub-headers automatically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36284].
  {panel}

Hi,

I have both a Confluence and a Jira instance running and I can link Confluence pages into Jira tickets and vice versa etc, that's all neat and great.

However, I have a Knowledgebase space set up, with a header page that has basically just one big Search box and it works perfectly for any and all confluence content.

However, I wish it would also return results from my linked Jira instance, i.e. Jira issues if their summary or other details match my search terms.
This would make my Knowledgebase page the one-stop shop for all our information management.

Is that something that could be integrated? Or maybe it has been and I am too stupid to find/configure it.

Many thanks,
Patrick
fields.summary: Search should list content from linked Jira instance
I cannot edit any confluence page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36279].
  {panel}

We use the RefinedWiki-Addon. A not logged in user only sees a small "Login"-Button in the upper right corner.
So, many people don't recognize that they are not logged in and wonder, why they can't find the needed information.
That's why we wonder, whether you could create an option to put a clearly visible Message on the screen to inform users that they are not logged in. This Message should disappear when they have logged in.
Thanks in advance
Hans
fields.summary: "Not-logged-in"-Message
Feature to Export All Blog Posts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36273].
  {panel}

If the user creates a page according to [Product Requirements Blueprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Product+Requirements+Blueprint], then if the user highlight some text on the page he has the option to create an issue associated to the Epic informed on the page.

!Screen Shot 2015-01-26 at 6.33.23 PM.png!

!Screen Shot 2015-01-26 at 6.33.58 PM.png!

However, if he's on edit mode, highlight the text doesn't work.

!Screen Shot 2015-01-26 at 6.34.44 PM.png!

There's a macro avalable for creating issues, but the issues don't get  assoaciated to the epic.

!Screen Shot 2015-01-26 at 6.35.03 PM.png!
fields.summary: Create issue from a Product Requirement page while on edit mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36271].
  {panel}

*Current Behaviour*
Administrator is not receiving a notification if he added or remove a user from the watch list of a page/space

*Feature Request*
Administrator should receive a notification if he added or remove a user from the watch list of a page/space
In addition to this, ability to send a notification to a user (watch the watchlist)  when a user is added or remove a user from the watch list of a page/space
fields.summary: Notification when a user is removed or added from the watch list
add default blueprint template for page properties report
Provide a notification for outdated pages and documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36265].
  {panel}

When you add users to group there should be a confirmation message that X users were added to the group. 

Too often you are adding multiple people to the group at once and of the 10 people you entered only 9 were added to the group, maybe you misspelt the other username or added a space in the wrong place or missed the comma, but the cruz of the issue is that there is no output message telling you only 9 of the 10 users were added. 

The only recourse is to manually check the list of users each time and check off the names you were adding. 

A simple message telling you who was added and who was not would be very beneficial.

Thanks,
Daniel
fields.summary: Adding users to a group should have a confirmation message
possibility of changing mentions in Page properties report in bulk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36262].
  {panel}

Since adding keyboard navigation / shortcut for Macro Browser (in CONF-15262) it lacks useful navigation paths in the browser itself for keyboard-only users!

# (/) default field / focus is search field 
#* (x) tab after search doesn't enter macro list
# (/) default tab after search field is category list 
# (x) category list can be navigated by up/down key
#* (x) tab after enter (select category) doesn't switch to the right macro selection
# (!) (x) tab / keyboard navigation in macro list is impossible
# (!) (x) tab select gets lost after some tabs (cancel, marketplace link in footer, next tab and it is lost)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36240].
  {panel}

Code Block Macro will render quoted string that begins with "http" or a valid link.

h3. How to Reproduce
# Insert a Code Block macro in a page.
# Add the following string and save the page.
• 'https://www.google.com.my'
• 'http/google'
• 'google'
• google
# Observe the results.
!codemacro.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unlink Links in Code Block Macro
Sort alphabetically the list of space's names
Edit button diasappeared
Allow support of inline comments on Excerpt Include text.
Option not to create recovery file during upgrade

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36232].
  {panel}

For most cases (and even more since CONF-5587 when copying rich snippets from web) images from "external" sources should be able to be cached by Confluence to give us

* independent Confluence content that doesn't relies on a third party server
\\ no remote server needs to be queried each time the page is displayed
* disallows "remote" manipulation of that what you are willing to document
* will fix the "insecure content" issue if HTTP images are included in HTTPs wiki instance

For me:
# we should get a default caching for all external images
# there should be an option at the image to disallow caching for some certain cases (opt-out)
# we should get a whitelist for the administrator for image serving
fields.summary: Allow Caching external images

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36228]. {panel} There are several places where the img tag for images is not properly closed, which breaks xhtml compatibility. This may not be dramatic for most browsers, but it is very critical for applications which render the content (of a macro or page) and then process it with XML tools. One example can be found in the demonstration space on the tutorial page (http://localhost:1990/confluence/display/ds/Tutorial for confluence 5.6.6) The source code of the page contains the following:



which is rendered by the XHTML renderer as:



Similar code is also produced in proiduction environments (e.g. https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Confluence+Plugin+Guide). If you have any questions, feel free to contact me.
fields.summary: XHTML Renderer doesn't close img tag
Enable Find for Jira issue macro text in edit mode

Hi,
I wrote a comment on a question on https://answers.atlassian.com and I added mysel as a watcher of this question.
As a result I'm getting every new questions on answers.atlassian.com per mail. 
I don't want that and I can't turn it off!
Please help!
Regards, Kai
fields.summary: I'm getting spammed by atlassian answers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36211].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When importing a word document, Confluence prints the following warning in the logs and the import fails:
{noformat}2015-01-20 12:47:18,445 WARN [http-bio-6565-exec-5] [com.benryan.webwork.WordImportAction] executeFileUpload Failed to delete uploaded file /var/atlassian/application-data/confluence/confluence-5.6.5/temp/upload_ed4f3045_e77f_48b6_b76b_e99d30ca6b0d_00000001.tmp
 -- url: /pages/worddav/importword.action | page: 1802242 | userName: alex | referer: http://aconde01:6565/pages/worddav/uploadimport.action?pageId=1802242 | action: importword
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to _Tools_ > _Import Word File_
# Select a file to upload and Click on next.
# The error message will appear in the logs, and an error might also generate in the UI. The following error was observed in a user's instance (even though there was no image in the instance that was this large):

The following error(s) occurred:
Could not import document. The document contains an image of size 6096000 x 2667000, which exceeds the maximum size of 900 x 1200. Reduce the size of the image or contact your administrator to raise the size limit.

h3. Expected Results

The import should be successful.

h3. Actual Results

The import fails and the tmp file is not removed per the logs.
 
h3.Workaround
One workaround found (with word documents including images) is to remove one of the images, attempt to upload the word doc (it should be successful), and then add the image back in once the page has been created.
fields.summary: Confluence try to delete temp file in Word Import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36209].
  {panel}

In the latest Chrome (39), the cursor is not auto focusing to the editor after selecting header type. It can't be replicated in IE and Firefox

*Steps to replicate*
# Edit a page / Create a page
# Ensure that the cursor is in the editor
# Click on the Toolbar to Change the text format from "Paragraph" to "Heading 1"
# Immediately start typing

*Observed Behaviour*
- The keyboard input doesn't get through or delayed thus the text with Heading 1 format won't be written in the editor
- This behaviour can be replicated when changing Font Color or Additional Formatting (Subscript, Superscript, Monospace). It seems that the editor doesn't return the focus whenever Toolbar with the type of combobox/selector is used
fields.summary: Editor doesn't auto focus after Changing Header Type from Toolbar In the Latest Chrome

Your current location in Sidebar should be displayed better

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36200].
  {panel}

When editing a page confluence overrides my browsers inbuilt search (control f) ability, however the implementation does not work as expected in that clicking 'next' after entering a search term does not take my browser to the occurrence of the term. 
Steps to reproduce:
1. go to create a confluence page 
2. on the create page screen enter text that fills your screen & then put the text 'findme' just on the next line so that it is not visible when you scroll up to the top of the page
3. then search for 'findme' it is highlighted.
4. observe that you are not taken to the 'findme' highlighted match.
fields.summary: Confluence search/find tool does not work as expected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36199].
  {panel}

I have a request for ability to require thread titles on comments, and auto-expand them then so that the users will be more tempted to simply reply to the thread than create new threads.

Example:
# Create thread with title *Concern Over Stability*
# Thread body: "Could you please review this page and elaborate how this feature will enhance the supportability of our software."
# Then users will reply to this thread and not just create a new comment.
fields.summary: Option to require thread title in comment threads

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36196].
  {panel}

Unless I miss something, there is still no sort capability for Confluence REST content.

According to [example|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Confluence+REST+API+Examples#ConfluenceRESTAPIExamples-Findblogposts], [API|https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/REST/latest/#d3e450] and [forum|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/306946/sort-order-in-rest-api-in-confluence-5.5], there is no sort feature at all.  

The consequence of this is that when listing content it comes out oldest first, needing all history ever to be gone through in order to get to the most recent, which would be used for any kind of remote 'recent' view, which is what we want to do, (eg most recent 50 blog posts).

This improvement is for a sort capability, by field, and ascending /descending.  The default field could easily by the contentId, sort order default to ASC to deliver current output, surely an afternoons work :) , enabling api to set sortOrder=DESC would surely be useful in a wider context?

If this is already logged somewhere (surely! but I couldn't find it), please link when marking as a duplicate.
fields.summary: Rest API /content/ needs sort order
Improve inline code style so it's more differentiated from standard paragraph text
"Office Excel" macro in Confluence - Grid display error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36190].
  {panel}

A space where to document a JIRA scheme.

A missing feature of JIRA is the ability to document the usage of screens and fields, workflows and so on for the benefit of the End User.
In would be nice to a have a very special confluence space, namely «Jira Help Space», where Jira admins can document all the elements above mentioned. 
The Space would be populated automatically by all the «documentable» entities of the JIRA scheme. At the same time, every element of the JIRA that has been provided with an help, would be enabled to show the documentation.
It would be so possible to:
- Document screens
- Document fields (possibily on screens)
- Document states (possibly on workflows)
- Document workflows (statuses, transitions, conditions, validations error messages…)
and so on… with an integrated help on line in Jira End User UI

Duplicated from https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-41653… dubts on pertinence :)
fields.summary: Jira Help Space

At the moment a user has to either:
* Type the URL manually
* Switch to Desktop version and then switch applications (and also the browser will remember you are in Desktop version the next time you are back in Confluence)

# Import it in Confluence 5.6.5

*What Happens*

The following error(s) occurred:
Backups made prior to Confluence 4.0 (build 3047) can not be restored. This backups build number was missing.
{code}

*What is expected*
* Something related to space export-import across major release is not allowed
* The above error is misleading as the backup was not made "prior to Confluence 4.0"

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36168].
  {panel}

To search my recently viewed pages, I type {{g + r}} which triggers a modal with a list and a live search.

I want the same for favorites, since right now exploring favorites is comparatively cumbersome and slow.  I have to:
# Click my profile icon
# Click the favorites link
# Wait for the favorites to load
# Browse the favorites 30 at a time
fields.summary: Add "Go to Favorites" modal like "Recently View Pages"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36165].
  {panel}

SSLv3 is an old protocol and has been superseded by TLSv1.0, TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2. TLSv1.0 was first defined in January 1999 and java 6 supports and uses it as the default client version in TLS handshake.

SSLv3 is old and limits the ciphers that can be used. SSLv3 is also vulnerable to POODLE. We should disable SSLv3 by default and provide a system property to re-enable it.

Note: Java 7 supports TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2 in client mode but defaults to using TLSv1 in the TLS handshake. We should use TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2 in client mode TLS in java 7 as well. Java 8 enables TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2 in client mode(in addition to SSLv3 and TLSv1) and uses TLSv1.2 by default in TLS handshake.

Workaround:
Upgrade to Oracle Java 7 update 76 (or higher) or Java 8 update 31(or higher) as these versions disable SSLv3.
Alternatively, set jdk.tls.disabledAlgorithms in <JRE_HOME>/lib/security/java.security to include SSLv3 as per the following example:
{code}
# Example:
#   jdk.tls.disabledAlgorithms=MD5, SSLv3, DSA, RSA keySize < 2048
jdk.tls.disabledAlgorithms=SSLv3
{code}
fields.summary: Disable SSLv3 in outgoing HTTPS connections from Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36162].

- http://answers.atlassian.com/questions/22861
-  https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/10402170/multiple-timezones-displayed-in-confluence.

Support Case: [JST-123465|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-123465]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36157].
  {panel}

I've recently discovered that the wiki doesn't apply images effects (such as "taped", "drop shadow" etc.) when images are too large. I can't find anywhere exactly _what_ those dimensions are, but my bigger problem is that the system provides no feedback whatsoever when this happens. When you apply image effects to a large photo, it lets you do it just fine, but it doesn't display the effect. This leads to a lot of confusion for the user--why isn't it working? Is it a problem with my computer? The image? The page?

If it were me, I would improve it as follows:

*Improve Documentation*
# Update the documentation to explain the outer limits of when image effects will be applied
# When a user applies an effect to an image that is too large, provide feedback to the effect of "This image is too large for effects to be applied. Please resize to be less than ____px by _____px if you would like to display image effects."

*Make the constraints larger*
Images that are 1600px by 500px should work, but it doesn't. These constraints should be more lenient. Why is there a limit at all? Is it a memory issue (like this [knowledge base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Image+effects+are+not+displayed+in+Confluence+5.5+or+later] article implies), or is there another reason?

*To recreate the problem...*
* Upload an image to the wiki that's bigger than 1599 by 449 pixels. 
* Click on the image, and select "Properties" from the pop-up menu
* Click any of the image effects that appear in the window
* Save the changes, and observe that the image doesn't look any different.
* Wish there was feedback to explain why the effect wasn't applied
fields.summary: Provide feedback when images are too large to apply image effects.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36155].
  {panel}

The only way to do this now is by 
# adding the macro to a page and copy/paste the result in another page (this does not work properly with IE)
# making an Excel export and copy/paste the required rows and columns.

It would be easier if you just can use the Jira macro and add a tick to the box "Static".
The option to select your required fields must be available too.
fields.summary: Ability to make the results of the jira issue macro static
Session ID Directions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36149].
  {panel}

h3. ***Improvement Request***
Allow users some way of choosing what is displayed in the Google Docs list macro.

h3. ***Use Case***
Currently, it appears that if you have more than 100 documents in Google Docs you can only see the first 100 that Google returns. If a company is using Google Docs (as ours is), it does not take long to exceed this limit. Only supporting 100 documents makes this feature unusable for any reasonably sized company that is using Google Docs and Google integration.

If you query to narrow the list, it still only searches the first 100 documents.

The request is to support Google Docs -- with all documents either through query or browsing. Currently it is unusable.
fields.summary: Google docs integration to include more than 100 total documents
Add an Allow in robots.txt for adding Team Calendars calendars to Google Calendars
Notify customers who export Confluence OnDemand that they will need to deploy a special version if they want to self-host

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36146].
  {panel}

Currently, OnDemand customers have no ability to control page breaks to create a clean pdf export.  This is critical when creating client-facing documentation as often you need to ensure content and tables or content and image are kept together. Or, you want to minimize orphan or widowed content - makes no sense to have a section header at the end of a page and the content start the next. 
There are hacks you can do, but they are not supported by Atlassian. 
Atlassian recommends using a Page Break user macro; however, OnDemand customers do not have the ability to add user macros nor can they add the HTML macro which would allow them to insert a page break using html. 
The easiest option is to provide the Page Break macro out of the box for OnDemand users.
fields.summary: Provide ability for OnDemand users to insert page breaks to have a clean pdf export
Ability to customise space layout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36144].
  {panel}

When logged in to an OnDemand account, JIRA tabs have a favicon but Confluence tabs do not making them difficult to locate in my tab bar.

In the attached screenshot there are three full tabs shown. From left to right:
1) Gmail
2) Confluence
3) JIRA
fields.summary: Confluence Favicon Missing in Atlassian OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36143].
  {panel}

Plugin and customisation options in Confluence OnDemand are deliberately constrained in order to provide a stable and scalable software-as-a-service solution. There are also good reasons to stick with the default UI, because users benefit from Atlassian's ongoing investment in the Confluence user experience.

However, many customers would like the ability to brand their Confluence OnDemand instance beyond the current colour and space logo options.

A happy medium between the two might be to provide some additional header and footer configuration options:

1. Allow a background image in the header and allow the header to grow up to an additional 40px in height, if desired (see attached example). This would make the header the same height as when the "temporary access to administrative functions" warning is displayed.
2. Allow a custom footer, implemented in a similar fashion to the site welcome message that would appear before the current footer (but not replace it). This could be used to create a "fat footer" for navigation or links to site terms and conditions etc.

This custom header would require some modification to the current navigation bar design:
- include a text only option instead of just logo + text or logo. Ideally the 'home' link text could be defined separately to the Site Title. This is because the customer's logo could instead be included in the background image.
- change the dimensions of the link hover behaviour so that the background is the same size as the 'Create' button.
fields.summary: Custom header and footer in Confluence OnDemand
Allow RSS Feed Macro in Confluence Cloud
Select a subset of Google documents to display with the Google Document List macro
Add capability to search Google Docs from with OnDemand (JIRA and Confluence)
Support for displaying drawings created with Google's Drawing tool in wiki
Add support for auto detection of GDOCS when trying to link a document

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36137].
  {panel}

When I create wiki pages, I see two different behaviors for html links.

1) A link added directly will +be underlined+.
2) A link cut and pasted from my previous wiki (Redmine), the link will not be underlined.

OnDemand offers no way to manage all link styles. I'd like to control this behaviour with a setting in the theme or to be able to customize my CSS.
fields.summary: Allow customized CSS in Confluence Cloud
Add Objective-C to CodeBlock macro
Alow users to import OnDemand Confluence backups generated via Backup Manager back to Confluence OnDemand.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36134].
  {panel}

Currently, OnDemand customers have no ability to enhance their content used for client facing documentation with either TOCs,notes, or attachments that should not be printed when a PDF export is created.  Having this minimizes having to break up content into separate pages, thus disrupting the flow of the information or making it confusing; it also requires more work to be done by the technical writer to create these separate pages and then making the appropriate references. 

Being able to have a no print around a set of attachments allows the user to be able to see what attachments are visible for the page (often, for us, this is a supporting reference or the actual handout to provide), but you don't want the attachment reference to appear on the export itself. 

There is no workaround for this except to create separate pages. 

There is an attribute on the TOC for noprint, but that is also a known bug, with no plans to fix. 

Atlassian recommends using a No Print user macro; however, OnDemand customers do not have the ability to add user macros It would be helpful to provide the No Print  macro out of the box for OnDemand users.
fields.summary: Provide ability for OnDemand users to insert a no print macro
Full-fledged Confluence OnDemand importer
Confluence comments in Jira Issues
Support Mail Archiving in Confluence
Add Space Name to Updates listings
Allow users to do personalized commenting without being an OnDemand user using OpenID, Google, Facebook accounts.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36126].
  {panel}

*Confluence-only* OnDemand users are getting incorrectly redirected to a 'Down for Maintenance' page instead of the actual error message (404) when trying to access a Confluence page without the */wiki* path.

For instance, if you try to access a Confluence page and type the /wiki path in the URL incorrectly (or even don't type it), Confluence will throw the 'Down for Maintenance' error, which causes confusion because the system is not actually down or unaccessible at the moment. The error should tell the user that the page does not exist (error 404), and not an error such as 503.

For instance, the following URL will work:

_<instance>_.atlassian.net/wiki/display/DOC/Documentation

However, the followings won't:

_<instance>_.atlassian.net/*wki*/display/DOC/Documentation - 'Down for Maintenance'
_<instance>_.atlassian.net/display/DOC/Documentation - 'Down for Maintenance'
fields.summary: Confluence only users getting incorrectly redirected to 'Down for Maintenance' instead of error 404
Wrong link to the Navigation Map macro documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36119].
  {panel}

Might be related to AOD-6510. I can't embed a Google spreadsheet into my Confluence document. I get the same 404 error as quoted in AOD-6510:

An error occurred while fetching the document. Please check to make sure that the document ID is valid and tat the document has not been deleted.

Interestingly, it found the spreadsheet and let me select it. It just doesn't show. I changed the sharing on the doc to everyone in my organization.

When I paste the link in the error directly into a browser I get a 404.

Attached screenshots of the issue.

Oh, also I can click on the "edit" link at the bottom of the page (see screenshot) and it takes me directly to the Google doc in edit mode.
fields.summary: Unable to embed new Google Spreadsheet (Google Sheets) into Confluence doc
Change global Space Themes page is not accessible via UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36116].
  {panel}

I can configure a favicon for JIRA but not for Confluence.

Confluence does display a favicon. Maybe because I somehow uploaded one a few months ago. Or it takes the global logo as a favicon. Both don't seem like expected behavior. Should be configurable separately - or just take over the favicon I uploaded in JIRA admin.

I would consider it an bug because it's quite confusing in the web browser.

Not sure, maybe this is a duplicate of AOD-6075 but I don't really understand AOD-6075.
fields.summary: Impossible to configure a favicon in Confluence OnDemand
